description: From mega- (prefix meaning ‘very large, great’) +‎ -lith (suffix meaning ‘stone’), a back-formation from megalithic probably modelled after monolith.

entries.meaning: A large stone slab making up a prehistoric monument, or part of such a monument.
A prehistoric monument made up of one or more large stones.
(by extension) A large stone or block of stone used in the construction of a modern structure.
